newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Dini says EU must not ignore Moslem states.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Dini says EU must not ignore Moslem states.

text.p: Italian Foreign Minister Lamberto Dini called on Thursday for the European Union to show greater interest in the problems of its Moslem neighbours.
Dini said ignoring the popualtion pressures and government instability of North African Moslem states could lead to Europe being overun with immigrants.
"Europe should not think of itself as an isolated island because in the end it will end up as a beseiged fortress," Dini told a conference on Europe's relations with Islam.
He said a more effective common EU foreign policy was needed to confront problems in the Moslem world.

"From the Arab-Israeli conflict to the Gulf War, from the Bosnian crisis to events in Algeria, there is not one problem in today's Islamic world which does not affect the stability and the development of Europe," he added.
